For a corpus description and full credits please see the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/gerdracor).","commit":"b8fae66cf992bd15df59b272fcb5f1db10c8c102","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/ger","title":"German Drama Corpus","name":"ger","acronym":"GerDraCor","metrics":{"text":750,"sp":467775,"male":11387,"wordcount":{"text":11818979.0,"sp":11262710.0,"stage":1371726.0},"stage":222172,"characters":16125,"plays":750,"updated":"2025-11-11T13:03:22.508+01:00","female":3356},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/gerdracor"},{"licence":"CC0","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/","description":"Edited by [Frank Fischer](https://lehkost.github.io/). This corpus contains all 37 of Shakespeare's plays in their German translations published by Schlegel and Tieck, in the edition of Aufbau-Verlag Berlin/Weimar (3rd edition 1975), which is based on the last edition published during Schlegel's lifetime (3rd edition 1843/44). The digitised print edition was procured from [Zeno.org](http://www.zeno.org/nid/20005683920) (via TextGrid Repository), which also provided an additional play (»Die beiden edlen Vettern«) that Shakespeare is now considered to have co-authored. For a full description please see the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/gershdracor).","commit":"a833b253b3c5ca52ba950662d7f69080c711d357","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/gersh","title":"German Shakespeare Drama Corpus","name":"gersh","acronym":"GerShDraCor","metrics":{"text":38,"sp":31763,"male":1308,"wordcount":{"text":873041,"sp":854906,"stage":32073},"stage":6885,"characters":1497,"plays":38,"updated":"2024-09-02T16:19:41.745+02:00","female":159},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/gershdracor"},{"licence":"CC BY-SA 3.0 US","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/us/","description":"39 plays derived from [Perseus Digital Library](http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/opensource/download), licenced under CC BY-SA 3.0 US. Menander's comedy \"Dyskolos\" derived from Wikisource, licenced under CC BY-SA 3.0. Maintained by Julia Jennifer Beine and Frank Fischer. Corpus description and list of enhancements in the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/greekdracor).","commit":"d41d08eafe9382c715ae3ffeeac2859ddd5fcda6","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/greek","title":"Greek Drama Corpus","name":"greek","acronym":"GreekDraCor","metrics":{"text":40,"sp":16097,"male":286,"wordcount":{"text":328406,"sp":327766,"stage":22},"stage":15,"characters":449,"plays":40,"updated":"2025-05-07T12:18:33.954+02:00","female":119},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/greekdracor"},{"description":"Edited by the Department of Digital Humanities at Eötvös Loránd University (ELTE) and the National Laboratory for Digital Heritage. Currently featuring 74 Hungarian-language plays from the 16th to the 20th century. For a corpus description and full credits please see the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/hundracor).","commit":"d335146ebe3c0f6727a378fd74a50c71b959b527","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/hun","title":"Hungarian Drama Corpus","name":"hun","acronym":"HunDraCor","metrics":{"text":74,"sp":55743,"male":1124,"wordcount":{"text":1081110.0,"sp":1033856.0,"stage":134267},"stage":28350,"characters":1718,"plays":74,"updated":"2024-05-31T15:36:26.767+02:00","female":393},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/hundracor"},{"licence":"CC0","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/","description":"This corpus is developed from HISe's scholarly edition of the Henrik Ibsen's Writings, which comprises all of Ibsen's published (and many unpublished) works. The project was started in 1999 and completed in 2010. It is maintained by the Centre for Ibsen Studies at the University of Oslo.\n\nThe works included in this DraCor corpus are all of Ibsen's published dramas, as well as his unpublished drama manuscripts. Also included are various versions of a selection of plays. The reason for this inclusion is that the versions often carry significant differences. Some may have been updated with a modernised language, and others in other formats. However, the versions typically carry with them semantic differences, which may be of interest for some areas of research.","commit":"406ecdd7205b894659f32c3646c10f78a6165bfb","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/ibs","title":"Ibsen Drama Corpus","name":"ibs","acronym":"IbsDraCor","metrics":{"text":37,"sp":37401,"male":394,"wordcount":{"text":766523,"sp":727402,"stage":80006},"stage":14356,"characters":754,"plays":37,"updated":"2025-10-17T14:54:49.335+02:00","female":177},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/ibsdracor"},{"description":"Derived from [Biblioteca Italiana](http://www.bibliotecaitaliana.it/), maintained by Frank Fischer, Carsten Milling, and Luca Giovannini. Features 157 Italian plays from 15th to 20th century. For corpus description and list of enhancements please consult the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/itadracor).","commit":"d7d5aff2a386409cf65bc0d1c9a96176dae430a7","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/ita","title":"Italian Drama Corpus","name":"ita","acronym":"ItaDraCor","metrics":{"text":157,"sp":79990,"male":1171,"wordcount":{"text":2282529.0,"sp":2142165.0,"stage":69028},"stage":14921,"characters":1768,"plays":157,"updated":"2025-06-04T19:34:56.515+02:00","female":470},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/itadracor"},{"licence":"CC0 1.0","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/","description":"Neo-Latin Drama Corpus, dramatic texts in [TEI P5](https://tei-c.org/guidelines/p5/) format. Licenced under [CC0 1.0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/). Edited by Julia Jennifer Beine (Julius-Maximilians-Universität Würzburg), maintained by Ingo Börner and Carsten Milling (both University of Potsdam). The texts in the Neo-Latin Drama Corpus were encoded and contributed by different working groups. For a full corpus description, the contributing working groups, and responsible editors, please consult the [README](https://github.com/dracor-org/neolatdracor) on GitHub.","commit":"d2008483fae03c17bf1148cab59b8d97dd05e29b","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/neolat","title":"Neo-Latin Drama Corpus","name":"neolat","acronym":"NeoLatDraCor","metrics":{"text":5,"sp":1563,"male":65,"wordcount":{"text":32665,"sp":29880,"stage":678},"stage":220,"characters":95,"plays":5,"updated":"2025-07-28T18:06:15.561+02:00","female":22},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/neolatdracor"},{"licence":"CC0","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/","description":"Edited by members of Historical Pragmalinguistic Team (Magdalena Pastuch, Barbara Mitrenga, Kinga Wąsińska) affiliated to the Institute of Linguistics of University of Silesia in Katowice with technical support Jan Wieczorek, Tomasz Bernaś and Tomasz Naskręt from CLARIN-PL/Wrocław University of Science and Technology. Features about 50 Polish-language plays from 1772 to 1939 with social, popular, and common themes reflecting the colloquial language of that era. For a corpus description and full credits please see the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/poldracor).","commit":"0af7e3d4cf4f752d0fabf150da58120c79d93ed2","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/pol","title":"Polish Drama Corpus","name":"pol","acronym":"PolDraCor","metrics":{"text":50,"sp":30854,"male":366,"wordcount":{"text":609156,"sp":575133,"stage":70621},"stage":16564,"characters":586,"plays":50,"updated":"2025-01-25T16:53:10.71+01:00","female":209},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/poldracor"},{"licence":"CC0","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/share-your-work/public-domain/cc0/","description":"Edited by Andrei Terian (coordinator), Ovio Olaru (deputy coordinator), Cristina Cojocaru (technical coordinator), Victor Cobuz, Alexandra Oprescu, Andreea Popescu, Teodora Susarenco, and Snejana Ung, members of the [METRA project](https://grants.ulbsibiu.ro/metra/) affiliated to the Lucian Blaga University of Sibiu. Features 30 Romanian-language plays from 1849 to 1944. For a corpus description and full credits please see the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/rodracor).","commit":"bc42770c33fffc58c67197fb3afab7221494729c","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/ro","title":"Romanian Drama Corpus","name":"ro","acronym":"RoDraCor","metrics":{"text":30,"sp":20147,"male":213,"wordcount":{"text":410107,"sp":403350,"stage":36797},"stage":7135,"characters":667,"plays":30,"updated":"2025-09-05T15:32:35.232+02:00","female":91},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/rodracor"},{"licence":"CC BY-SA 3.0 US","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/us/","description":"Derived from [Perseus Digital Library](http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/opensource/download), updated to [TEI P5](https://tei-c.org/guidelines/p5/) and enhanced by Julia Jennifer Beine and Frank Fischer (both Freie Universität Berlin). Features 36 plays (20 comedies by **Plautus**, 6 comedies by **Terence**, 10 tragedies by **Seneca**). For a corpus description and full credits please see the [README on GitHub](https://github.com/dracor-org/rusdracor).","commit":"bc1290a187b8944186696bdc0e36e8b2cc192688","uri":"https://dev.dracor.org/api/v1/corpora/rus","title":"Russian Drama Corpus","name":"rus","acronym":"RusDraCor","metrics":{"text":212,"sp":119333,"male":2608,"wordcount":{"text":2316995.0,"sp":2191657.0,"stage":215112},"stage":49440,"characters":3707,"plays":212,"updated":"2025-11-24T14:14:15.064+01:00","female":871},"repository":"https://github.com/dracor-org/rusdracor"},{"licence":"CC BY-NC 3.0","licenceUrl":"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/3.0/deed.en_US","description":"Derived from the [Folger Shakespeare Library](https://shakespeare.folger.edu/). Based on the corpus data, I need to calculate the mean number of characters per play for each corpus by dividing the total number of characters by the number of plays:

- als: 375 characters / 30 plays = 12.50
- am: 762 characters / 40 plays = 19.05
- ar: 140 characters / 8 plays = 17.50
- bash: 56 characters / 3 plays = 18.67
- cal: 3406 characters / 205 plays = 16.62
- cze: 364 characters / 11 plays = 33.09
- dutch: 2175 characters / 186 plays = 11.69

- fre: 17830 characters / 1940 plays = 9.19
- ger: 16125 characters / 750 plays = 21.50
- gersh: 1497 characters / 38 plays = 39.39
- greek: 449 characters / 40 plays = 11.23
- hun: 1718 characters / 74 plays = 23.22
- ibs: 754 characters / 37 plays = 20.38
- ita: 1768 characters / 157 plays = 11.26
- neolat: 95 characters / 5 plays = 19.00
- pol: 586 characters / 50 plays = 11.72
- ro: 667 characters / 30 plays = 22.23
- rom: 405 characters / 36 plays = 11.25
- rus: 3707 characters / 212 plays = 17.49
- shake: 1433 characters / 37 plays = 38.73
- span: 580 characters / 25 plays = 23.20
- swe: 769 characters / 68 plays = 11.31
- tat: 30 characters / 3 plays = 10.00
- test: 93 characters / 4 plays = 23.25
- u: 1132 characters / 47 plays = 24.09
- yi: 119 characters / 8 plays = 14.88
